overrides.description: A list of results for the query.

id.description: The unique ID assigned to this override.

href.description: The URL to the override.

filename.description: The filename for the finding being overridden.

rule.description: The rule that is being is overridden. Use `*` to override findings for all rules.

registry.description: The image registry where the finding is overridden. Use `*` to override findings in all registries.

repository.description: The image repository where the finding is overridden. Use `*` to override findings in all repositories. Use `organization/*` to override findings in all repositories under `organization`.

tag.description: The image tag where the finding is overridden. Use `*` to override findings in all image tags.

created.description: The time that the override was created.

updated.description: The time that the override was last updated.

expires.description: The time that the override expires. If not present, the override will not expire.

comment.description: A free-form comment field for your notes.
comment.example: Allowing demo.pem private key for 30 days. Contact alice@example.com for details.

next.description: An encoded value that you can use to retrieve the next set of results for a query. If `next` is not present, then there are no more results available.

200.description: The response body contains the override object.

Sunset.description: If present, this API endpoint has been deprecated and may be removed at any point after the reported date. The timestamp is an HTTP date string in the format `Fri, 11 Nov 2018 11:11:11 GMT`.

X-Request-Id.description: The request ID assigned to this request.

X-Api-Version.description: The API version used in this request.

X-Api-Notice.description: If present, this header will include important API information. We will use this header as one way to notify you that a new API version is available or that the API you are using is going to be removed.

id.description: The unique ID assigned to this override.

href.description: The URL to the override.

filename.description: The filename for the finding being overridden.

rule.description: The rule that is being is overridden. Use `*` to override findings for all rules.

registry.description: The image registry where the finding is overridden. Use `*` to override findings in all registries.

repository.description: The image repository where the finding is overridden. Use `*` to override findings in all repositories. Use `organization/*` to override findings in all repositories under `organization`.

tag.description: The image tag where the finding is overridden. Use `*` to override findings in all image tags.

created.description: The time that the override was created.

updated.description: The time that the override was last updated.

expires.description: The time that the override expires. If not present, the override will not expire.

comment.description: A free-form comment field for your notes.
comment.example: Allowing demo.pem private key for 30 days. Contact alice@example.com for details.

400.description: Something about your request didn't quite make sense. The error message should help you figure out what went wrong.

additionalProperties.description: An error message describing the error in the field identified by the property name.

```

```
in all requests. You can get a token from the `POST /api/sessions` API.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: An encoded value used to retrieve the next set of results for a query that returns more than `limit` results.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Space-separated strings to search for.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of records to return.

parameters.name: X-Api-Version
parameters.description: The version of the API to use.

200.description: The response body contains the list of checklist finding override objects.

Sunset.description: If present, this API endpoint has been deprecated and may be removed at any point after the reported date. The timestamp is an HTTP date string in the format `Fri, 11 Nov 2018 11:11:11 GMT`.

X-Request-Id.description: The request ID assigned to this request.

X-Api-Version.description: The API version used in this request.

X-Api-Notice.description: If present, this header will include important API information. We will use this header as one way to notify you that a new API version is available or that the API you are using is going to be removed.

overrides.description: A list of results for the query.

id.description: The unique ID assigned to this override.

href.description: The URL to the override.

identifier.description: The identifier for the finding being overridden.

profile.description: The profile for the identifier that is being overridden. Use `*` to override findings for all profiles.

checklist.description: The checklist for the profile that is being overridden. Use `*` to override findings for all checklists.

registry.description: The image registry where the finding is overridden. Use `*` to override findings in all registries.

updated.description: The time that the override was last updated.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: An encoded value used to retrieve the next set of results for a query that returns more than `limit` results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of records to return.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Space-separated strings to search for.

parameters.description: The version of the API to use.

200.description: The response body contains the registry records.

items.description: The registry object. Credentials will not be included in this object.

id.description: The registry ID.

href.description: The URL at which the registry can be found.

name.description: The name to display for the registry.

description.description: A longer-form note to attach to the registry.
description.example: This registry is an example, and this description is similarly exemplary.

host.description: The host where the registry can be found.

insecureSkipVerify.description: If `true`, Deep Security Smart Check will not verify TLS connections to the registry. Use this only in controlled environments where you know that connections between the Deep Security Smart Check scanner and the registry are secured by other means.

rootCAs.description:
(optional, default: `null`) If present, the service will use the provided root CAs as the trusted root CAs for registry requests. The value should be a base-64 encoded list of PEM-encoded certificates. If not present, the service will use a set of built-in trusted root CAs.
If `insecureSkipVerify` is set to `true`, then the root CAs are not checked.

filter.description: The filters that define the repositories and tags that will be synchronized from the registry. The maximum size of the filters for a registry is 32768 bytes.

include.description: A pattern to use when determining which images to synchronize (include) from the registry.

exclude.description: A pattern to use when determining which images to synchronize (exclude) from the registry.

content.description: Metrics capturing information about the content of the registry.

repositories.description: The number of repositories with content in the registry.

images.description: The number of images in the registry.

scans.description: Metrics capturing information about the scan status of images in the registry.

pending.description: The number of images in the registry that have not yet been scanned.

inProgress.description: The number of images in the registry that are currently being scanned.

ok.description: The number of images in the registry where the last scan status is that the scan had no findings.

warnings.description: The number of images in the registry where the last scan status is that the scan had findings.

errors.description: The number of images in the registry where the last scan status is that the scan encountered an error.

cancelled.description: The number of images in the registry where the last scan status is that the scan was cancelled.

scanners.description: Metadata about the scanners that produced the results.

malware.description: Metadata for the malware scanner.

updated.description: The time that the malware pattern database was last updated.

vulnerabilities.description: Metadata for the vulnerability scanner.

updated.description: The time that the vulnerabilities database was last updated.

vulnerabilityPatterns.description: Metadata for the vulnerability pattern scanner.

status.description: Availability of the vulnerability pattern scanner.

date.description: The time that the vulnerability patterns were last published.

updated.description: The time that the vulnerability patterns were last synchronized from the vulnerability feed.

malware.description:
The number of malware items that were found.
high:

contents.description: The number of content findings found by severity.

total.description: The total number of content findings categorized by severity.

defcon1.description: The number of "Defcon1" content findings that were found.

critical.description: The number of critical content findings that were found.

high.description: The number of high-severity content findings that were found.

medium.description: The number of medium-severity content findings that were found.

low.description: The number of low-severity content findings that were found.

negligible.description: The number of negligible content findings that were found.

unknown.description: The number of content findings with unknown severity that were found.

unresolved.description: The number of unresolved content findings that were found by severity. Unresolved content findings are content findings that were found in the image and were not resolved by an override.

defcon1.description: The number of "Defcon1" content findings that were found.

critical.description: The number of critical content findings that were found.

high.description: The number of high-severity content findings that were found.

medium.description: The number of medium-severity content findings that were found.

low.description: The number of low-severity content findings that were found.

negligible.description: The number of negligible content findings that were found.

unknown.description: The number of content findings with unknown severity that were found.

vulnerabilities.description: The number of vulnerabilities found by severity.

total.description: The total number of vulnerabilities that were found by severity.

defcon1.description: The number of "Defcon1" vulnerabilities that were found.

critical.description: The number of critical vulnerabilities that were found.

high.description: The number of high-severity vulnerabilities that were found.

medium.description: The number of medium-severity vulnerabilities that were found.

low.description: The number of low-severity vulnerabilities that were found.

negligible.description: The number of negligible vulnerabilities that were found.

unknown.description: The number of vulnerabilities with unknown severity that were found.

unresolved.description: The number of unresolved vulnerabilities that were found by severity. Unresolved vulnerabilities are vulnerabilities that were found in a layer and were not fixed by an update in a subsequent layer.

defcon1.description: The number of "Defcon1" vulnerabilities that were found.

critical.description: The number of critical vulnerabilities that were found.

high.description: The number of high-severity vulnerabilities that were found.

medium.description: The number of medium-severity vulnerabilities that were found.

low.description: The number of low-severity vulnerabilities that were found.

negligible.description: The number of negligible vulnerabilities that were found.

unknown.description: The number of vulnerabilities with unknown severity that were found.

checklists.description: The number of security checklist findings.

total.description: The total number of security checklist findings.

defcon1.description: The number of "Defcon1" security checklist findings.

critical.description: The number of critical security checklist findings.

high.description: The number of high-severity security checklist findings.

medium.description: The number of medium-severity security checklist findings.

low.description: The number of low-severity security checklist findings.

negligible.description: The number of negligible security checklist findings.

unknown.description: The number of security checklist findings with unknown severity.

unresolved.description: The number of unresolved security checklist findings.

defcon1.description: The number of "Defcon1" security checklist findings.

critical.description: The number of critical security checklist findings.

high.description: The number of high-severity security checklist findings.

medium.description: The number of medium-severity security checklist findings.

low.description: The number of low-severity security checklist findings.

negligible.description: The number of negligible security checklist findings.

unknown.description: The number of security checklist findings with unknown severity.

history.description: Aggregate metrics over a period of time.

scans.description: The number of scans performed on images in the registry in the time period. Will be `-1` if there was an error calculating the value.
The number of scans performed on images in the registry in the time period. Will be `-1` if there was an error calculating the value.

schedule.description: If `true`, this registry will be scheduled for daily re-scan.

status.description:
Reports the status of the connection from Deep Security Smart Check to the registry.
* `pending`: Deep Security Smart Check has not yet attempted to connect to the registry
* `ok`: The last connection attempt to the registry was successful.
* `failed`: The last connection attempt to the registry failed.

statusDetail.description: Reports additional detail when the status is `failed`.

created.description: The time that the registry connection was created.

updated.description: The time that the registry connection was last modified.

next.description: An encoded value that you can use to retrieve the next set of results for a query. If `next` is not present, then there are no more results available.

name.description: The name to display for the registry. If not specified, the registry `host` value will be used as the initial name.

description.description: A longer-form note to attach to the registry.
description.example: This registry is an example, and this description is similarly exemplary.

host.description: The host where the registry can be found. Required except when using Amazon Elastic Container Registry.

credentials.description: Credentials to use when accessing the registry.

username.description: (optional) Use this if your source requires requests to be authorized using basic username + password authentication. Requests will include an `Authorization: Basic {encoded username + password}` header.

password.description: (optional) Use this if your source requires requests to be authorized using basic username + password authentication. Requests will include an `Authorization: Basic {encoded username + password}` header.

aws.description: The AWS-specific information for authenticating to the registry.

region.description: The AWS region identifier for the region where the registry is located.

accessKeyID.description: The optional AWS IAM access key identifier to use when requesting the registry authorization token. If `roleID` is also set, then `accessKeyID` is the AWS IAM access key ID used to authorize the AWS STS `AssumeRole` request to assume the role. If `accessKeyID` is not set, then the default credential chain is used.

secretAccessKey.description: The optional AWS IAM secret access key to use when requesting the registry authorization token. If `roleID` is also set, then `secretAccessKey` is the AWS IAM secret access key used to authorize the AWS STS `AssumeRole` request to assume the role.

role.description: The optional AWS IAM role to assume when requesting the registry authorization token. If `accessKeyID` is also set, then `accessKeyID` and `secretAccessKey` are used to authorize the STS `AssumeRole` API request when assuming this role. If AccessKeyID is not set, then the default credential chain is used when assuming the role.

externalID.description: The optional "external ID" to use when calling the AWS STS `AssumeRole` API to assume the role specified in `roleID`. The external ID may be required by the trust policy on the role being assumed.

roleSessionName.description: The optional "role session name" to use when calling the AWS STS AssumeRole API to assume the role specified in `roleID`. If `roleSessionName` is not provided, then `DeepSecuritySmartCheck` will be used.

registry.description: The optional registry ID to use to get the registry authorization token. This can be used to access the registry in another AWS account. If not provided, the default registry will be used.

insecureSkipVerify.description: If `true`, Deep Security Smart Check will not verify TLS connections to the registry. Use this only in controlled environments where you know that connections between the Deep Security Smart Check scanner and the registry are secured by other means.

rootCAs.description:
(optional, default: `null`) If present, the service will use the provided root CAs as the trusted root CAs for registry requests. The value should be a base-64 encoded list of PEM-encoded certificates. If not present, the service will use a set of built-in trusted root CAs.
If `insecureSkipVerify` is set to `true`, then the root CAs are not checked.

filter.description: The filters that define the repositories and tags that will be synchronized from the registry. The maximum size of the filters for a registry is 32768 bytes.

include.description: A pattern to use when determining which images to synchronize (include) from the registry.

exclude.description: A pattern to use when determining which images to synchronize (exclude) from the registry.

schedule.description: If `true`, this registry will be scheduled for daily re-scan.

parameters.name: dryrun
parameters.description: Use the `dryrun=true` query parameter to indicate that the request should only be tested for validity and should not actually create a record. The response code will indicate whether the request was OK (`200 OK`) or whether there was a problem in the request.

parameters.name: ping
parameters.description: Use `false` to disable automatic checking of the registry host and credentials during the update.

parameters.name: X-Api-Version
parameters.description: The version of the API to use.

200.description: The response body contains the registry details. This response will only be returned if the `dryrun=true` query parameter was sent.

Sunset.description: If present, this API endpoint has been deprecated and may be removed at any point after the reported date. The timestamp is an HTTP date string in the format `Fri, 11 Nov 2018 11:11:11 GMT`.

schema.description: The registry object. Credentials will not be included in this object.

id.description: The registry ID.

href.description: The URL at which the registry can be found.

name.description: The name to display for the registry.

description.description: A longer-form note to attach to the registry.
description.example: This registry is an example, and this description is similarly exemplary.

host.description: The host where the registry can be found.

insecureSkipVerify.description: If `true`, Deep Security Smart Check will not verify TLS connections to the registry. Use this only in controlled environments where you know that connections between the Deep Security Smart Check scanner and the registry are secured by other means.

rootCAs.description:
(optional, default: `null`) If present, the service will use the provided root CAs as the trusted root CAs for registry requests. The value should be a base-64 encoded list of PEM-encoded certificates. If not present, the service will use a set of built-in trusted root CAs.

filter.description: The filters that define the repositories and tags that will be synchronized from the registry. The maximum size of the filters for a registry is 32768 bytes.

include.description: A pattern to use when determining which images to synchronize (include) from the registry.

exclude.description: A pattern to use when determining which images to synchronize (exclude) from the registry.

content.description: Metrics capturing information about the content of the registry.

repositories.description: The number of repositories with content in the registry.

images.description: The number of images in the registry.

scans.description: Metrics capturing information about the scan status of images in the registry.

pending.description: The number of images in the registry that have not yet been scanned.

inProgress.description: The number of images in the registry that are currently being scanned.

ok.description: The number of images in the registry where the last scan status is that the scan had no findings.

warnings.description: The number of images in the registry where the last scan status is that the scan had findings.

errors.description: The number of images in the registry where the last scan status is that the scan encountered an error.

cancelled.description: The number of images in the registry where the last scan status is that the scan was cancelled.

scanners.description: Metadata about the scanners that produced the results.

malware.description: Metadata for the malware scanner.

updated.description: The time that the malware pattern database was last updated.

vulnerabilities.description: Metadata for the vulnerability scanner.

updated.description: The time that the vulnerabilities database was last updated.

vulnerabilityPatterns.description: Metadata for the vulnerability pattern scanner.

status.description: Availability of the vulnerability pattern scanner.

date.description: The time that the vulnerability patterns were last published.

updated.description: The time that the vulnerability patterns were last synchronized from the vulnerability feed.

status.description:
Reports the status of the connection from Deep Security Smart Check to the registry.
* `pending`: Deep Security Smart Check has not yet attempted to connect to the registry
* `ok`: The last connection attempt to the registry was successful.
* `failed`: The last connection attempt to the registry failed.

created.description: The time that the registry connection was created.

updated.description: The time that the registry connection was last modified.

schema.description: The registry object. Credentials will not be included in this object.

id.description: The registry ID.

href.description: The URL at which the registry can be found.

name.description: The name to display for the registry.

description.description: A longer-form note to attach to the registry.
description.example: This registry is an example, and this description is similarly exemplary.

host.description: The host where the registry can be found.

insecureSkipVerify.description: If `true`, Deep Security Smart Check will not verify TLS connections to the registry. Use this only in controlled environments where you know that connections between the Deep Security Smart Check scanner and the registry are secured by other means.

rootCAs.description:
(optional, default: `null`) If present, the service will use the provided root CAs as the trusted root CAs for registry requests. The value should be a base-64 encoded list of PEM-encoded certificates. If not present, the service will use a set of built-in trusted root CAs.
If `insecureSkipVerify` is set to `true`, then the root CAs are not checked.

filter.description: The filters that define the repositories and tags that will be synchronized from the registry. The maximum size of the filters for a registry is 32768 bytes.

include.description: A pattern to use when determining which images to synchronize (include) from the registry.

exclude.description: A pattern to use when determining which images to synchronize (exclude) from the registry.

content.description: Metrics capturing information about the content of the registry.

repositories.description: The number of repositories with content in the registry.

images.description: The number of images in the registry.

scans.description: Metrics capturing information about the scan status of images in the registry.

pending.description: The number of images in the registry that have not yet been scanned.

inProgress.description: The number of images in the registry that are currently being scanned.

ok.description: The number of images in the registry where the last scan status is that the scan had no findings.

warnings.description: The number of images in the registry where the last scan status is that the scan had findings.

errors.description: The number of images in the registry where the last scan status is that the scan encountered an error.

cancelled.description: The number of images in the registry where the last scan status is that the scan was cancelled.

scanners.description: Metadata about the scanners that produced the results.

status.description:
Reports the status of the connection from Deep Security Smart Check to the registry.
* `pending`: Deep Security Smart Check has not yet attempted to connect to the registry
* `ok`: The last connection attempt to the registry was successful.
* `failed`: The last connection attempt to the registry failed.

statusDetail.description: Reports additional detail when the status is `failed`.

created.description: The time that the registry connection was created.

updated.description: The time that the registry connection was last modified.

post.description: Modify the details of a registry connection.

name.description: The name to display for the registry. If not specified, the registry `host` value will be used as the initial name.

description.description: A longer-form note to attach to the registry.
description.example: This registry is an example, and this description is similarly exemplary.

host.description: The host where the registry can be found. Required except when using Amazon Elastic Container Registry.

credentials.description: Credentials to use when accessing the registry.

username.description: (optional) Use this if your source requires requests to be authorized using basic username + password authentication. Requests will include an `Authorization: Basic {encoded username + password}` header.

password.description: (optional) Use this if your source requires requests to be authorized using basic username + password authentication. Requests will include an `Authorization: Basic {encoded username + password}` header.

aws.description: The AWS-specific information for authenticating to the registry.

region.description: The AWS region identifier for the region where the registry is located.

accessKeyID.description: The optional AWS IAM access key identifier to use when requesting the registry authorization token. If `roleID` is also set, then `accessKeyID` is the AWS IAM access key ID used to authorize the AWS STS `AssumeRole` request to assume the role. If `accessKeyID` is not set, then the default credential chain is used.

secretAccessKey.description: The optional AWS IAM secret access key to use when requesting the registry authorization token. If `roleID` is also set, then `secretAccessKey` is the AWS IAM secret access key used to authorize the AWS STS `AssumeRole` request to assume the role.

role.description: The optional AWS IAM role to assume when requesting the registry authorization token. If `accessKeyID` is also set, then `accessKeyID` and `secretAccessKey` are used to authorize the STS `AssumeRole` API request when assuming this role. If AccessKeyID is not set, then the default credential chain is used when assuming the role.

externalID.description: The optional "external ID" to use when calling the AWS STS `AssumeRole` API to assume the role specified in `roleID`. The external ID may be required by the trust policy on the role being assumed.

roleSessionName.description: The optional "role session name" to use when calling the AWS STS AssumeRole API to assume the role specified in `roleID`. If `roleSessionName` is not provided, then `DeepSecuritySmartCheck` will be used.

registry.description: The optional registry ID to use to get the registry authorization token. This can be used to access the registry in another AWS account. If not provided, the default registry will be used.

insecureSkipVerify.description: If `true`, Deep Security Smart Check will not verify TLS connections to the registry. Use this only in controlled environments where you know that connections between the Deep Security Smart Check scanner and the registry are secured by other means.

rootCAs.description:
(optional, default: `null`) If present, the service will use the provided root CAs as the trusted root CAs for registry requests. The value should be a base-64 encoded list of PEM-encoded certificates. If not present, the service will use a set of built-in trusted root CAs.
If `insecureSkipVerify` is set to `true`, then the root CAs are not checked.

filter.description: The filters that define the repositories and tags that will be synchronized from the registry. The maximum size of the filters for a registry is 32768 bytes.

include.description: A pattern to use when determining which images to synchronize (include) from the registry.

exclude.description: A pattern to use when determining which images to synchronize (exclude) from the registry.

schedule.description: If `true`, this registry will be scheduled for daily re-scan.

parameters.name: dryrun
parameters.description: Use the `dryrun=true` query parameter to indicate that the request should only be tested for validity and should not actually modify the record. The response code will indicate whether the request was OK (`200 OK`) or whether there was a problem in the request.

parameters.name: ping
parameters.description: Use `false` to disable automatic checking of the registry host and credentials during the update.

parameters.name: X-Api-Version
parameters.description: The version of the API to use.

post.description: Create a scan using stored registry details.

name.description: (optional) A descriptive name for the scan.

source.description: The source of the image to scan.

repository.description: The repository name.

tag.description: The tag of the image to scan.

digest.description: The digest value of the image to scan.

webhooks.description: (optional) A list of web hooks to call when events happen for the scan.

name.description: (optional) A descriptive name for the web hook.

hookUrl.description: The URL that Deep Security Smart Check should `POST` the event payload to.

secret.description:
(optional) If you provide a `secret` value, then events sent over HTTP will include an `X-Scan-Event-Signature` header that is the SHA-256 HMAC of the event body using your secret as the key.

*This value is write-only: the API will not return the secret or show that it has been set.*

insecureSkipVerify.description: (optional, default: `false`) If `true`, the web hook will not verify TLS connections to the web hook URL. Use this only in controlled environments where you know that connections between the Deep Security Smart Check scanner and the hook URL are secured by other means.

rootCAs.description:
(optional, default: `null`) If present, the web hook will use the provided root CAs as the trusted root CAs for HTTPS web hook requests. The value should be a base-64 encoded list of PEM-encoded certificates. If not present, the web hook will use a set of built-in trusted root CAs.
If `insecureSkipVerify` is set to `true`, then the root CAs are not checked.

active.description: (optional, default: `false`). If `true`, the web hook will be invoked whenever a matching event occurs.

events.description: (optional, default: `["*"]`) If present, this is a list of event types that will be checked before calling the web hook. If the event type matches one of the elements of the list, the web hook will be called. If the list is empty, *all* events will match.

parameters.name: dryrun
parameters.description: Use the `dryrun=true` query parameter to indicate that the request should only be tested for validity and should not actually create a record. The response code will indicate whether the request was OK (`200 OK`) or whether there was a problem in the request.

parameters.name: X-Api-Version
parameters.description: The version of the API to use.

200.description: The response body contains the scan details. This response will only be returned if the `dryrun=true` query parameter was sent.

Sunset.description: If present, this API endpoint has been deprecated and may be removed at any point after the reported date. The timestamp is an HTTP date string in the format `Fri, 11 Nov 2018 11:11:11 GMT`.

X-Request-Id.description: The request ID assigned to this request.

X-Api-Version.description: The API version used in this request.

X-Api-Notice.description: If present, this header will include important API information. We will use this header as one way to notify you that a new API version is available or that the API you are using is going to be removed.

id.description: The unique ID assigned to this scan.

href.description: The URL to the scan resource.

name.description: If you provided a name for the scan, it will be returned here.

type.description: The type of image that is being scanned.

registry.description: (for scan type `docker` only) The registry hostname or IP address.

repository.description: (for scan type `docker` only) The repository name.

tag.description: (for scan type `docker` only) The tag of the image to scan.

digest.description: (for scan type `docker` only) The digest value of the image to scan.

insecureSkipVerify.description: (optional, default: `false`) If `true`, the scan will not verify TLS connections to the source URL. Use this only in controlled environments where you know that connections between the Deep Security Smart Check scanner and the source are secured by other means.

rootCAs.description:
(optional, default: `null`) If present, the scan will use the provided root CAs as the trusted root CAs for HTTPS web hook requests. The value should be a base-64 encoded list of PEM-encoded certificates. If not present, source requests will use a set of built-in trusted root CAs.
If `insecureSkipVerify` is set to `true`, then the root CAs are not checked.

detail.example: More details about the scan status
detail.description: (optional) More details about the scan status.

requested.description: The time that the scan was requested.

started.description: The time that the scan started. This value will not be present if the scan has not yet started.

updated.description: The time that the scan was last updated. This value will not be present if the scan has not yet started.

completed.description: The time that the scan completed. This value will not be present if the scan has not yet completed.

digest.description: The image digest for the scanned image. This value will only be present for Docker scans.

os.description: The target operating system for the scanned image. This value will only be present for Docker scans.

architecture.description: The target architecture for the scanned image. This value will only be present for Docker scans.

labels.description: The labels associated with the scanned image. This value will only be present for Docker scans.

results.description: A list of the scan results by layer.

id.description: A layer identifier. For scans of type `docker`, this will be the layer's `digest` value. This attribute will not be present for scans of type `http`.

createdAt.description: For scans of Docker images, this attribute will show the time at which the layer was created.

createdBy.description: For scans of Docker images, this attribute will show the Docker daemon command that ran to create this layer. This is not an exact match to the `Dockerfile` line, but will help to provide better context of the results.

malware.description: If present, a URL pointing to the list of malware that was found. See List layer malware findings.

vulnerabilities.description: If present, a URL pointing to the list of vulnerabilities that were found. See List layer vulnerability findings.

contents.description: If present, a URL pointing to the list of content scan results that were found. See List layer content findings.

scanners.description: Metadata about the scanners that produced the results.

malware.description: Metadata for the malware scanner.

updated.description: The time that the malware pattern database was last updated.

vulnerabilities.description: Metadata for the vulnerability scanner.

updated.description: The time that the vulnerabilities database was last updated.

vulnerabilityPatterns.description: Metadata for the vulnerability pattern scanner.

status.description: Availability of the vulnerability pattern scanner.

date.description: The time that the vulnerability patterns were last published.

updated.description: The time that the vulnerability patterns were last synchronized from the vulnerability feed.

X-Request-Id.description: The request ID assigned to this request.

X-Api-Version.description: The API version used in this request.

X-Api-Notice.description: If present, this header will include important API information. We will use this header as one way to notify you that a new API version is available or that the API you are using is going to be removed.

id.description: The unique ID assigned to this scan.

href.description: The URL to the scan resource.

name.description: If you provided a name for the scan, it will be returned here.

type.description: The type of image that is being scanned.

registry.description: (for scan type `docker` only) The registry hostname or IP address.

repository.description: (for scan type `docker` only) The repository name.

tag.description: (for scan type `docker` only) The tag of the image to scan.

digest.description: (for scan type `docker` only) The digest value of the image to scan.

insecureSkipVerify.description: (optional, default: `false`) If `true`, the scan will not verify TLS connections to the source URL. Use this only in controlled environments where you know that connections between the Deep Security Smart Check scanner and the source are secured by other means.

rootCAs.description:
(optional, default: `null`) If present, the scan will use the provided root CAs as the trusted root CAs for HTTPS web hook requests. The value should be a base-64 encoded list of PEM-encoded certificates. If not present, source requests will use a set of built-in trusted root CAs.
If `insecureSkipVerify` is set to `true`, then the root CAs are not checked.

detail.example: More details about the scan status
detail.description: (optional) More details about the scan status.

requested.description: The time that the scan was requested.

started.description: The time that the scan started. This value will not be present if the scan has not yet started.

updated.description: The time that the scan was last updated. This value will not be present if the scan has not yet started.

completed.description: The time that the scan completed. This value will not be present if the scan has not yet completed.

digest.description: The image digest for the scanned image. This value will only be present for Docker scans.

os.description: The target operating system for the scanned image. This value will only be present for Docker scans.

architecture.description: The target architecture for the scanned image. This value will only be present for Docker scans.

labels.description: The labels associated with the scanned image. This value will only be present for Docker scans.

results.description: A list of the scan results by layer.

id.description: A layer identifier. For scans of type `docker`, this will be the layer's `digest` value. This attribute will not be present for scans of type `http`.

createdAt.description: For scans of Docker images, this attribute will show the time at which the layer was created.

createdBy.description: For scans of Docker images, this attribute will show the Docker daemon command that ran to create this layer. This is not an exact match to the `Dockerfile` line, but will help to provide better context of the results.

malware.description: If present, a URL pointing to the list of malware that was found. See List layer malware findings.

vulnerabilities.description: If present, a URL pointing to the list of vulnerabilities that were found. See List layer vulnerability findings.

contents.description: If present, a URL pointing to the list of content scan results that were found. See List layer content findings.

scanners.description: Metadata about the scanners that produced the results.

updated.description: The time that the malware pattern database was last updated.

vulnerabilities.description: Metadata for the vulnerability scanner.

vulnerabilityPatterns.description: Metadata for the vulnerability pattern scanner.

status.description: Availability of the vulnerability pattern scanner.

date.description: The time that the vulnerability patterns were last published.

updated.description: The time that the vulnerability patterns were last synchronized from the vulnerability feed.

ok.description: The number of images in all registries where the last scan status is that the scan had no findings.

warnings.description: The number of images in all registries where the last scan status is that the scan had findings.

errors.description: The number of images in all registries where the last scan status is that the scan encountered an error.

cancelled.description: The number of images in all registries where the last scan status is that the scan was cancelled.

X-Api-Version.description: The API version used in this request.

X-Api-Notice.description: If present, this header will include important API information. We will use this header as one way to notify you that a new API version is available or that the API version you are using is going to be removed.

expires.description: Timestamp when the license will expire.

gracePeriod.description: Grace period after expiry (in days) when the product will still update.

entitlements.description: The entitlements granted by the license (if any).

registries.description: The number of registries that are currently permitted by the license. A value of `-1` indicates that unlimited licenses can be created.

updates.description: If the system is unlicensed, it will not receive malware pattern updates and the value for `updates` will be `false`.

400.description: Something about your request didn't quite make sense. The error message should help you figure out what went wrong.

message.example: Something went wrong. To fix it, try ...
message.description: The error message will explain what went wrong and will attempt to give some hints as to how to fix it.

fields.description: If present, the `fields` object will indicate which input fields had errors; the attribute name will be the name of the input field and the value will be an error message.

additionalProperties.description: An error message describing the error in the field identified by the property name.

401.description:
Did you forget to include a session token in your request? You need to include
```
Authorization: Bearer [token]
```
in all requests. You can get a token from the `POST /api/sessions` API.
